intro: Galium bingoelense, commonly known as the Bingoelense Bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium bingoelense is native to specific regions in southern Africa and is adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
